sentence: Stock indexes in the U.S. extended the day's declines near the close on Tuesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average shedding nearly 200 points to head to its lowest level on a closing basis since late March.

The Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 also retreated after inflation data in April topped estimates at 0.4% month-on-month, prompting speculation that the Federal Reserve might raise interest rates this year.
Also in economic data, industrial production accelerated by 0.7% in April, beating projections for a gain of 0.2%.
March, however, was revised downward to negative 0.9% from an initial negative 0.6%.
The consumer staples and utilities sectors on the S&P 500 both fell about 2%, leading all 10 groups lower just before the close.
All but two of the 30 Dow components fell, with Home Depot ( HD ) down 3% even after reporting better-than-expected earnings.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
